results.title: Product & Graphic Designer
results.description:
With the support of Vacuumlabs we have been working on a new FinTech product called Moneyhoon - a digital financial specialist with AI/ML components that will replace outdated financial advisors as we know them.
Moneyhoon brings clarity to abstract terms such as money, savings, investments, or insurance. You can be there not only to witness the creation of a revolutionary product but also to participate in making it real.

So that each and every one of us can manage our finances easily and independently, yet constantly having access to real experts. Imagine you have a trustworthy partner that provides understandable answers to questions like “Inflation is here. I have some cash. What should I do?”
Our vision is to bring peace of mind through better organizing our finances. We´re first and foremost building a product we need ourselves.
Our recruitment process is in place to ensure you can work with the most efficient and high-quality team.

 

We are looking for a Product & Graphic Designer for our project as part of the Moneyhoon team.
As a designer, you should be a problem solver who crafts practical and beautiful user experiences. Together with the team, you’ll help break down business and customer problems, imagine new and elegant solutions, and help bring great experiences to life.
Creating and editing graphic designs? It is a piece of cake for you.

 

What you’ll do

  • Contribute to our project Moneyhoon by making product improvements, as well as working on new product features from scratch.

  • Explore and communicate design concepts through sketches, user flows, low fidelity wireframes and prototypes.

  • Participate in design research, user research, and validation testing.

  • Communicate with team members throughout the process to ensure the designs fit the business goals and technical constraints.

  • Work closely with engineers to bring designs to life.

  • Advocate for best practices across the team.

  • Contribute to improving the end-to-end product delivery process, as well as our internal processes.

  • Create and edit graphic designs - visuals, banners, websites, flyers, newsletters, brochures, social media formats, and more types of different media.

     

What you'll need

  • A deep knowledge of mobile and web app design patterns and UX best practices.

  • An appreciation for the entire product development process - from idea generation and research to detailed UI/UX design.

  • Willingness to make decisions and take ownership of your work.

  • Experience with Figma and Adobe graphic tools.

  • Bonus skills such as UX writing and basic motion design are very appreciated.

     

What we offer

  • Work from Home and flexible hours.

  • Performance and compensation evaluations.

  • Unlimited sick days.

  • Paid days for professional growth.

  • Community and team-building activities.

 

Practicals

Location: Bratislava, Slovakia (but we also support remote cooperation from any location within Slovak or Czech Republic)
Starting Date: ASAP
Compensation: 2.500-3.500€/monthly based on your experience and seniority

results.title: Senior Product Designer
results.description:
About TrustedHousesitters

TrustedHousesitters is a global marketplace that is disrupting the pet care and travel industries. We connect a community of home and pet owners with sitters to solve a common two-sided problem - pet care and cost-effective travel. Customers join for one annual fee. After that, sits take place as a trust-based, money-free exchange that sees owners enjoy worry-free travel while our sitters enjoy the company of pets and unlock a world of unique accommodation.

We're fully in scale-up mode and have grown to be the only global platform of its kind. In the last few years, we’ve consistently achieved high year-on-year growth, and have remained resilient throughout the COVID-19 crisis. Thanks to strong tailwinds in the pet and travel industry in the post-Covid world, 2022 has been our strongest year so far. We closed a $10m series A funding round in 2021, and have an ambitious growth strategy to execute going forward.

We've recently made the transition to a remote-first business, however we've retained a HQ in central Brighton which is available for collaborative working and in-person meetups.

Requirements

We’re looking for a talented Senior Product Designer to join our Product team. This is a great opportunity to help scale TrustedHousesitters.

Ideal Start Date: January 2023

This is a remote UK-based role. Sorry, but we can't employ non UK-based candidates and sponsor visas at the moment.

What you’ll do at TrustedHousesitters

  • You will be working on member success and experience initiatives
  • As a Senior Product Designer for our Member Success team squad, you’ll work with developers, PM, data analyst and other stakeholders to help shape and contribute towards the product vision and roadmap for your area of product
  • Help uncover user problems through qualitative and quantitative research
  • Find solutions through ideation and creation of prototypes and testing
  • Partner with other designers, product and engineering to oversee and ensure quality user experience from conception to launch and continuous product iterations
  • Nurture best practices, investing in design standards, systems, and processes

 

Our ideal candidate will have demonstrable experience in :

  • Product design; leading projects from conception through to completion and successfully identifying and solving user problems
  • Strong UX focus, with ability to balance business and user needs
  • Designing for web and mobile apps (iOS and Android)
  • Interaction and visual design, prototyping, and testing
  • Conducting qualitative and quantitative research including user interviews
  • Interpreting data to inform design decisions
  • Experimentation and A/B testing
  • Writing or briefing product copy
  • Working within and contributing to design systems
  • Planning and running ideation sessions with cross functional team members
  • Putting user experience at the heart of the decision-making process and championing user led design within an organisation
  • Adapting designs across platforms with an understanding of their limitations and opportunities

Our ideal candidate will also have

  • A strong portfolio showcasing your work
  • 3+ years of experience designing products and solving user problems

We would love it if you could also demonstrate

  • Startup experience
  • Marketplace experience
  • Growth experience

 

Salary £60k-£70k per annum dependent on experience

Benefits

  • Fully remote work
  • Discretionary annual bonus scheme
  • 25 days holiday annually
  • Pension scheme: 5% from you as an employee and 3% from TrustedHousesitters
  • Premium TrustedHousesitters pet owner and sitter membership which includes benefits like airport lounge passes, sit cancellation insurance, and home and contents insurance for sits
  • Our team have an unlimited housesitting allowance, can work remotely from their sits, and TrustedHousesitters will contribute up to £500 per year towards travel costs
  • Monthly working from home stipend
  • Find a rescue pet to join your family and we’ll cover the adoption fees, as well as pawternity to help any pet settle into their new home.
  • We host a quarterly all expenses paid meetup, and will fund team events (remote or in person) throughout the year
  • We can cover costs of personal development resources, and have regular time set aside for personal development
  • Health Insurance plan
  • Brighton Bikeshare
  • Recruitment Referral Bonus
  • Access to Spaces Locations across the globe

results.title: Senior UX Designer
results.description:
About Us

Qualio is on a mission to empower life science teams to launch and scale life-saving products. We’re doing that by building a connected and integrated quality management platform for the entire life science ecosystem. Qualio is trusted by 100s of highly regulated international customers, ranging from the bleeding edge of computational biology and machine learning to household names in mRNA vaccine development. 

The Qualio team is an all-remote, globally distributed workforce with teammates in over ten countries.

What’s the opportunity?

We are looking for a Senior UX Designer who will be joining our growing Product team. Together with product managers and engineers you will shape the user experience of Qualio and make a difference through helping life-saving products to get to market. You will focus on  specific product areas and you will own all design-related aspects: from concept all the way to production design. You will also have an opportunity to improve the experience working on features that span the entire product. You will be able to use qualitative and quantitative data to drive your design decisions and validate your ideas with customers. We are looking for someone who enjoys a start-up environment where there are plenty of opportunities to bring their experience, creativity and entrepreneurial spirit - and have a critical impact on the user experience. 

What will I be doing?
  • Design simple, elegant, user-centric experiences that delight users and achieve their goals.
  • Define the Qualio user experience, interactions, and user interface through user flows, information architecture and visual design.
  • Test and validate design decisions against internal stakeholders and customers with mockups / prototypes throughout the design process.
  • Influence how we work by helping establish best design practices/operations
  • Ensure the quality and delivery of the user experience of the product  in collaboration with engineering.
What skills do I need?
  • 3-5 years of experience as a UX/UI/Interaction Designer role building B2B products from concept to completion managers and engineers to deliver solutions that solve the customer problem
  • Passion for the OOUX framework (also known as conceptual modeling or conceptual design), or a focus on early-stage UX work 
  • Has led large complex initiatives within organizations that involve multiple stakeholders and teams
  • Strong storyteller who can develop concepts to delight customers and deliver business results
  • A compelling portfolio of work that demonstrates high-quality design work and deep design thinking
  • Skilled ‘visual’ designer who can help shape and add to the developing product design style.
  • Highly skilled in Figma (design systems, prototyping)
  • Strong written and verbal communication skills (in English)

Bonus requirements:

  • Experience in the Life Sciences industry.
  • Experience developing design systems and component libraries
  • Comfortable sharing your work via video recordings with any size audience.
  • Outside the box thinking that questions the future of the product vision.
Benefits 
  • Competitive salary
  • Matching 401k
  • Medical, Dental, and Vision Benefits
  • Dependent & Health FSA, Short/Long Term Disability, Basic & Voluntary Life Insurance
  • Unlimited PTO policy
  • Company allowance for home office supplies
  • 12 weeks paid parental leave
  • Opportunity to make a difference through helping life-saving products get to market
A note to candidates:

Studies have shown that women and people of color are less likely to apply for jobs unless they believe they meet every single one of the qualifications as described in a job description. We are committed to building a diverse and inclusive company and we are most interested in finding the BEST candidate for the job. That candidate may be one who comes from a less traditional background, and that’s okay. We would strongly encourage you to apply, even if you don't believe you meet every one of the qualifications described.

 

##Qualio_NA #Qualio_ET #Qualio_CT #LI-Remote

results.title: Art Production Manager
results.description:
At Lockwood, our vision is to bring people together through Avakin Life so they can play, share and socialise! Listed as one of Europe’s fastest growing tech companies by the FT our journey’s only just begun. With great benefits including an employee share scheme and profit related quarterly bonus we’re always looking for talented individuals to join team. This is a great opportunity to be at the forefront of an exciting new direction for Lockwood, driving the growth of our products as well as being a driving force for improving processes and delivery framework.

The Art Production Manager is crucial to facilitating the creation of high-quality content for our product, Avakin Life. You will be an experienced production manager in art production, reporting into the Head of Content Production. Working closely alongside the Head of Content Production, Associate Art Director, Creative Director, and the Central Production Team, you will understand the processes and pipeline for art production of internal and external with outsourcing partners, define dependencies, issues and blockers, and implement the mitigation plans to resolve those. You will bring structure to our creative teams while collaborating with the project leadership and other disciplines to maintain communication in all directions.

We trust our Art Production Manager to ensure that assets are delivered on time; with quality, within budget and adhere to established pipelines. You are proactive in monitoring the content creation process from concept to build and beyond, working to mitigate production issues should they arise.

This role can be based out of any of our Lockwood offices (Cambridge, Lisbon, Nottingham, Newcastle, Vilnius) or fully remote with the option of office work at your discretion.

Responsibilities

 

  • POC for content production
  • Work closely with the Head of Content production to implement strategic initiatives, product and department goals
  • Quarterly ideation and planning with the art teams and producers
  • Planning and delivery of art assets requirements for product features
  • Support the art teams with planning, tracking and delivery of high volume and quality art asset releases
  • Anticipate and address potential problems like resource blockers, quality concerns, schedule and scope changes.
  • Support the team to maintain and deliver art direction and requirements set by Associate Art director and Content Directors
  • Work with content producers to align delivery of art and in game experiences for our players
  • Support content leads with artist assignment & sign off process
  • Support Content publishing team in case of issues with art assets or asset pipeline process.
  • Risk and (cross team) dependency management
  • Close collaboration and support of publishing team and QA to meet release deadlines
  • Forecasting and planning of Outsource requirements
  • Coordinate assignments, asset delivery, feedback and bug fixing
  • Support creation of outsource material and briefs
  • Work with OS partner to continuously improve quality of asset delivery
  • Ensure art pipeline and teams are setup efficiently
  • Improving pipelines, methods and the appropriate use of skills within the team to improve the efficiency and effectiveness of Art Production
  • Identify and communicate art tool requirements and support planning, review and testing of art tools
  • Support art review and sign off process

 

Requirements

  • Significant art management experience working in a multi-national game production environment
  • In depth knowledge of 3D character and environment pipeline and processes
  • Planning high volume art asset and releases
  • Outsource management experience
  • Attention to details whilst not losing sight of the big picture
  • Agile mindset and ability to quickly adapt to changes
  • Change management experience
  • Agile practices
  • excellent communication and organizational skills
  • Familiar with several project management and bug tracking software (e.g. Jira)

 

Desirables

 

  • Metaverse experience
  • Live Ops experience
  • Background as a 3D artist
  • Line management experience

results.title: Senior Technical Artist
results.description:

We are looking for an awesome senior technical artist who has a solid background within mobile app/game development and experience of art pipelines, workflows and build processes. The role will involve working with our content, build and engineering teams, and maintaining/improving/reimagining our existing processes, pipelines and tooling.

This role can be based out of any of our Lockwood offices (Cambridge, Lisbon, Nottingham, Newcastle, Vilnius) or fully remote with the option of office work at your discretion.

results.title: Senior Environment Artist
results.description:
Perfect Storm Studios was founded by Game Industry Veterans to build the next generation of games. We believe that the best games will be those that can seamlessly integrate amazing game design, player rewards, and joint development with our player community. We are a fully remote company which actively puts the employees and community first. Perfect Storm Studios has an A+ excellent culture that is the perfect balance of both fun interactions and fulfilling work. Head on over to our website to learn more about our project!


The Role:

Perfect Storm Studios is looking for a Senior Environment Artist to support the creative and artistic development of our game. As a Senior Environment Artist, you will be responsible for modeling and texturing stylized 3D Environment Assets as well as helping to set, decorate and build out exciting locations.

Key Responsibilities:

- Have a good eye for lighting and establishing mood for a game world
- Conduct research for subjects and trends to support design solutions
- Work with the Central Art Team to produce a wide range of in game content of 3D assets and materials to create a unique look and feel to the game world
- Work in an iterative manner taking assets from blockouts to final game quality
- Work with Creative Directors to ensure all assets match art direction and style
- Ensure all assets are produced to benchmark quality
- Model high and low poly objects, bake textures, export/import assets, apply and create materials, assemble environments

Requirements

  • Comprehensive knowledge of industry standard 3D Software
  • Knowledge of industry standard pipelines and workflows, asset exporting process and implementation within the game.
  • Experience working with Unity and Lighting 3D Environments|
  • Keen understanding of current and new world building techniques and technologies and a desire to push quality while maintaining technical performance
  • At least 3-5+ years of experience as an Environment Artist

Application Requirements:

  • Portfolio demonstrating relevant artistic skills and past work
  • An art test may be required

Benefits

  • Flexible PTO
  • Competitive Compensation (Location Dependent)
  • Full Remote and Location Independence

Type of Position: Full-time
Location: REMOTE
Synchronous Core Hours: 9AM - 2PM PST

results.title: Product Designer, Analytics
results.description:
Company Description

We believe that now is the time to reevaluate the impact of spaces we create to live, work, and play. Building sustainably at a global scale requires better tools and technology for the people involved. We're attacking this at the core -- Outer Labs provides modern human-centric apps for stakeholders who can directly influence the way real estate, architecture, and construction decisions are made in their projects.

Some questions we find ourselves asking: ​How can we help an Architect explore thousands of ideas in the time it currently takes to explore one? How can software optimize the quality of space for usability while reducing the cost and resources required to build?​ How do we encourage adoption of reusable solutions that can be manufactured more sustainably and efficiently?

Answers to these questions require deep expertise in design and engineering that comes from every level of our company. This is why we’ve invested deeply in building a culture that empowers its employees to do great work and directly shape the future of its products. We want smart, creative, and intentional individuals to be part of our core team. Are you in?



Job Description

As a Product Designer for Analytics, you’ll work on a wide variety of challenging problems across a portfolio of clients and internal R+D efforts. Your core focus will be creating analytical tools that real estate owner teams are using for strategic planning and forecasting.

You’ll work directly with our clients who own and operate large occupant-focused real estate portfolios. You’ll leverage the insight of our product managers and strategists to build a point of view for the user, then bring your designs to life with our world-class engineering team using the latest and greatest technology. As part of a growing team, you’ll also get to shape the design culture at Outer Labs and directly influence the process of design and innovation.

Responsibilities

  • Coordinate with Product Strategists to gather design research and market analysis for use in addressing stakeholder perspectives
  • Partner with Product Management, Product Strategy, and Engineering project team members to develop a user-centric point of view for the product.
  • Express design intent with high-quality mockups and clickable prototypes that embody the end-to-end user journey.
  • Leverage the full range of design expertise at Outer Labs by working closely with other designers to sharpen your intuition and iterate through your designs.
  • Facilitate the handoff of design requirements, clickable prototypes, and assets to developers by working closely with Product Managers and Engineering lead.
  • Advocate for user experience, field questions, and make adjustments as you work throughout the implementation phase.
  • Ensure the final result provides the intended value to stakeholders by responding to feedback and making adjustments as needed.


Qualifications
  • Relevant experience and portfolio working as a Product Designer, User Experience (UX) Designer, or similar role
  • Deep knowledge of user experience research and market analysis frameworks
  • Experience building and iterating on user journeys from design research
  • Experience wireframing, designing and prototyping in Figma, or similar application
  • Excellent eye for aesthetic design and latest design trends
  • Understanding of UX patterns and ability to work with Design Systems
  • Exceptional verbal and written communication skills
  • Driven by curiosity with exceptional attention to detail
  • Preference for fast-paced iteration, deadlines, and budgets
  • Experience with AEC industry is preferred


Additional Information

Benefits

  • Healthcare, dental, and vision insurance for employee & dependents.  We cover 85% of the cost for employee, and 75% of the cost for dependents

  • 401K with matching up to 4% of your salary

  • Paid parental leave for all new parents

  • Unlimited PTO

  • 11 paid company holidays

  • Computer and home office setup with phone and internet paid for up to $100 each.

  • Annual stipend for education and professional development

  • 100% remote working

 

Outer Labs provides equal employment opportunities to all employees and applicants for employment and prohibits discrimination and harassment of any type without regard to race, color, religion, age, sex, national origin, disability status, genetics, protected veteran status, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, or any other characteristic protected by federal, state or local laws.

results.title: Sr. Product Designer

We are a small but growing company and anticipate robust growth in 2022-23. TixTrack HQ is in Los Angeles with a presence across the US, including NYC and international markets including the UK, Australia, and New Zealand.

Job Summary

The Sr. Product Designer collaborates with founders, product managers, engineers, and customers to design simple, user-friendly, and beautiful designs for the Nliven Subscriptions & Payment Plans. This position reports directly to the Sr. Product & Integration Manager (Nliven Subscription Solution).

This position is full-time and fully remote.

  • Develop and implement product strategies consistent with company vision.
  • Design elegant flows and experience across multiple media.
  • Design gorgeous, user-centered experiences across our platforms.
  • Lead product design through active design sessions, work review, and feedback.

results.title: Product Designer
results.description:
PLEASE NOTE THIS ROLE IS FOR OVERSEAS APPLICATION, NON -U.S. ONLY. NO DOMESTIC (U.S.) APPLICATIONS WILL BE CONSIDERED.

Product Designer

What defines our next Product Designer...

Scentbird is looking for a visionary Product Designer to help conceive, wireframe, design and implement all of our various product design initiatives between four of our OWNED BRANDS. 

These are brands under the umbrella of Scentbird, but are their own solo entities. Confessions of a Rebel, Deck of Scarlet, Sanctuary and Good Habit.

The perfect candidate will have a deep understanding of UX, with partnered problem solving skills, as well as the highest level of craft for UI design, creating beautiful, modern experiences for immersive, mobile first environments. This Product Designer will be responsible for developing engaging experiences that allow ease-of use within our customer base, while telling an immersive story and eliciting an emotional response from them through rich visual design.

The successful candidate will work closely with our Product Design Director to deliver ideas and experiences that create a visionary future for each of these brands, while exceeding the expectations of our customers. Being part of a team of thinkers and doers, the right Product Designer will bring a mix of high-level problem solving through UX, creative vision through UI, an understanding of research, usability testing, A/B testing and business understanding to the position, promoting our company from within and inspiring each team member they partner with.

We're looking for a person comfortable wearing many hats and managing multiple projects at one time. Someone that can inspire others, taking our creative experiences to a new level, as we continue to grow. 

What You'll Be Responsible For:

  • Concept, design and manage various product design initiatives from our quarterly roadmap, and understanding areas of opportunity for higher levels of engagement with our customers.
  • Having a firm grasp on the brand, customer and company needs for each of these four brands.
  • Lead reviews by speaking through your ideas and vision, so all partners can understand the path and know how to improve the designs/experience.
  • Gather design inspiration and be a leader of sharing new ideas/designs that can help push our UX and UI designs to new levels of fidelity.
  • Be the steward of our design components library, creating the vision, design, layout and rationale on how we use our brand components.
  • Meet with the Product Designer Director weekly to align on scope and vision for the ongoing projects and the future of the four brands.
  • Work closely with the Creative Director of Brands to help facilitate their vision for photography & tonality, as it helps elevate the brand.
  • Work with product owners to help understand surveys, customer interviews and usability testing so that these may contribute to your work.
  • Work with Engineers to facilitate ease of transition from design to build, forming a collaborative partnership that's efficient and effective.

What We Would Love You to Have:

  • A clear understanding and passion for complex UX flows. You think strategically, putting the customer needs and company needs at equal balance, which are reflected in your ux flows.
  • An ability to think about the entirety of company goals. Revenue and KPI focused. 
  • Passion for design and beauty, you are a master digital designer, it is your superpower, you look at every nuance of a design and help bring it to immersive life through every small-to-large detail of UI design.
  • You're able to spot and help encourage new design trends in the web space.
  • Able to solve complex User Experience problems, smoothly and efficiently.
  • Able to wireframe an experience and speak to each customer decision, every piece of potential engagement and see the story end-to-end.
  • The ability to think through high-level Information Architecture to realize the scope of a project and know it's emphasis on the entire experience as a whole.
  • Ability to give and take creative direction.
  • Detail-oriented and a precision to your style of work.
  • Ability to prioritize and handle multiple projects in order to meet tight deadlines.
  • Excellent communication skills.
  • The ability to work with internal and external cross-functional teams both domestically and internationally.
  • In-depth knowledge of Figma, components and auto layout.

What You'll Need to Have:

  • 3+ years experience in digital design is required. A portfolio showcasing agency work as well as in-house work would be ideal.
  • Digital design experience in the beauty (or fashion) industry
  • Degree in Design, Arts, and/or Digital Design. 
  • A robust portfolio showcasing various use cases of solving for product challenges

What You'll Love About Us:

  • Competitive base compensation
  • Bonus program
  • Paid Time Off
  • Volunteer Time Off
  • Wellness Days Off
  • A fun, creative and energetic work environment.

About Scentbird:

Scentbird inspires fragrance lovers to go beyond the ordinary and sample scents that evoke passion, confidence, and the unknown. Our mission is to revolutionize the way we perfume by bringing the ultimate fragrance playground right to your fingertips and offering a digital subscription service that lets members choose from over 500+ designer perfumes each month.

About the Brands:

  • Scentbird: The easiest way for fragrance lovers to discover, try, and buy their favorite scented products without a commitment
  • Deck of Scarlet: Deck of Scarlet was created to break the boredom and shake up clean beauty. The line of bold cosmetics features vivid colors, innovative textures, and unprecedented finishes that bring the fun and creativity back to clean beauty.
  • Confessions Of A Rebel: We're not afraid to provoke. Our fragrances are made to excite and inspire: some are subversive, others are straightforward, all are compelling in their own right. He, she, they, YOU - our confessions are not caged in by gender.
  • Goodhabit: Built for the digitally native generation, Goodhabit is pioneering the movement in defending your skin against artificial blue light and modern day skin stressors. We're developing clean, conscious, and effective skincare solutions that keep you connected, and your skin, protected.
  • Sanctuary: Our newest brand to the Scentbird family. This fragrance, just like the playful creature that was its muse, this scent opens with an energetic blend of red berries and fresh bamboo as a nod to the Red Panda's favorite foods, while pink pepper adds an extra lively twist. Verdant notes like white tea, violet, and oakmoss pay homage to its habitat in the Himalayan Forests and mountains of China, as cashmere woods evoke a soft, cuddly feeling.
  • Drift: drift is uprooting the traditional air-care market. With beautifully designed products that blend in with bespoke scents that stand out. We take pride in our fragrances, keeping them free from the traditional chemicals used in the fragrance industry. We are always phthalate and paraben free. drift's subscription customer base is loyal and growing fast.

Scentbird is committed to bringing individuals from different backgrounds and perspectives into the Nest. We strive to uphold an inclusive environment where individuals of all different backgrounds, ages, colors, ethnicities, gender, or gender identities, genetics, physical or mental abilities, protected veteran status, race, religious or sexual orientation, thrive. We respect the laws enforced by the EEOC and are dedicated internally to going above and beyond in fostering diversity. Come as you are - we're excited to meet you.

Salary range: $45,000 - $55,000 *

* All compensation is at the discretion of the company and based on applicant's experience.

results.title: Senior Product Designer
results.description:
Our job everyday is to protect the data and critical assets of businesses world-wide by discovering hidden vulnerabilities… before the bad guys do!

At CybelAngel, we see beyond perimeters to protect businesses from the most critical cybersecurity threats. Fortune 500 Global to mid-size companies world-wide, trust CybelAngel’s global team of approximately 200 team members to protect their businesses from digital threats. With a combination of advanced machine learning, cyber analysis expertise, and a powerful suite of software solutions, CybelAngel detects and resolves our clients potential threats, long before they can fall into the hands of cyber criminals.

Our capabilities expand every day to uncover new risks, detect more threats, protect more clients, and create new possibilities for our employees.

With offices in Boston, Paris, and London, CybelAngel’s global footprint allows for a thriving hybrid, office and remote-work environment. We are looking for exceptional ‘go-getters’ who share our ambitious vision, innovative culture, high commitment to ethics, and enthusiasm for being the best possible place to work!

Our values:

  • Be Bold
  • Be Curious
  • Stronger Together

 

We’re looking for our future Senior Product Designer.

You will be responsible for all aspects of user experience across all our applications: customer portal, backoffice and APIs. Our apps are used daily by cybersecurity analysts from our clients all over the world. They are relying on our product to analyze thousands of potential security incidents. Design is key to help them assess the severity of a threat and save time when managing thousands of alerts every day.

You agree that Product Design function should :

  • Participate in all phases from discovery to delivery to iterations rather than building a design after PM specifications
  • Constantly test their ideas with real users
  • Be measured on the success of the product rather than quality of design

Product Design Team

  • Currently 1 Product Design Director and 1 Product Designer (consultant)
  • Vision for 2023: 1 Product Design Director, 3 Product Designers
  • Working closely with 1 Product Director, 5 PM, 1 staff PM, 1 Product Knowledge Manager
  • Our Design stack : Figma, Figjam, ProductBoard, Amplitude, Confluence

Your missions

  • Partner with a Product Manager & the engineering team for one of our teams, lead by a product goal
  • Conduct product discovery & user research to guide product & design decisions by factual user feedback, and increase our user knowledge
  • Facilitate ideation workshops with cybersecurity experts, product & engineering teams
  • Produce prototypes to explore and test hypotheses and iterate on them
  • Define flows, information architecture and meaningful user interface
  • Deliver UI design with an attention to component consistency
  • Collaborate with developers during the whole product lifecycle (technical issues anticipation, handoff, iteration…)

Requirements

Your preferred experience

  • 5 to 7 years of experience building and shipping world-class products across various platforms
  • Collaborative approach and belief that the best products are built through a partnership with Product, Design, and Engineering
  • Great communication skills and the ability to clearly articulate your design decisions and how they relate to the problem you’re solving
  • Excellent organizational and time management skills
  • Experience applying user research methodologies and product data/analytics to inform design decision
  • Experience with SaaS, B2B or other complex technical systems (APIs, Machine learning, heavy data products)
  • Fluent both in english and french

If you do not meet the requirements but you think you are a great fit, you are welcome to apply and explain why !

Benefits

Our Product & Engineering Culture

🗃️ Small teams & short iterations

🤝 Culture of sharing, pair and mod programming, when it makes sense

👩‍🎨 Quality time dedicated to technical design

🧙‍♂️Half the software engineers have over 10 years of experience

🎒 Voyager Program to change team temporarily and discover how they work #becurious

✌️ Cooldown week dedicated to learning and experimenting

🤼 Whole team buildings each semester #strongertogether

🧠 Career path & trainings #bebold

📍 Remote options from everywhere in Europe (but you can come to our amazing office near Parc Monceau whenever you want, and it's paid by the company up to once a month)

Our Benefits

💰 Salary range: 70-75k euros based on your level of seniority and competencies you will demonstrate during the hiring process

🏦 5% bonus, based on company and individual performances

💸 Stock options for every employee

🍱 Debit card for paying for lunch, with company contribution.

💛 Very friendly and benevolent atmosphere with parties (CEO is an ex-DJ), sport sessions, board games nights, music band…

👊🏻 DE&I group

🌍 Green team

🥓 Free English Courses

🏋🏾‍♀️ Class Pass credits for your gym sessions

90% of our People recommend CybelAngel

92% are happy with the work life balance at CybelAngel

 

Your hiring journey with us

  • 30’ call with Pierre, Recruiter, to discuss about expectations from both ends
  • 45’ call with Maureen, Product Design Director, to discuss context and projects and to evaluate mission fit
  • 60’ call with Maureen, Romain, Senior Product Designer and one Product Manager to assess your skills with a product case of your own choosing

results.title: Lead Product Designer
results.description:
At LaunchNotes, diversity and inclusion are core values. Candidates with diverse and/or underrepresented backgrounds are encouraged to apply.

--

Design at LaunchNotes
 

Design is a critical organization at LaunchNotes. We solve problems for our users by discovering what our users need and why. We believe in problem-solving by cultivating curiosity, experimenting early and often, collaborating across teams, applying empathy, and researching. We love feedback and we’re always listening, learning, and improving. At LaunchNotes, design isn’t an afterthought or a decoration - it’s a core value. We are growing quickly and need a Lead Product Designer to be an individual contributor while also leading a team of 2 designers.

 

What you’ll do
  • Create simple, intuitive, delightful user experiences and interfaces while balancing vision, craft, speed, and business needs
  • Concept and create design deliverables such as sketches, wireframes, high fidelity mockups, design system components, prototypes, etc.
  • Collect feedback, data, insights and iteratively incorporate them into your designs.
  • Continuously improve our design processes, principles, systems, tooling and amplify the LaunchNotes design culture
  • Own the design system and contribute to its growth and efficacy
  • Partner with our product team to represent the voice of the user, conduct user research, and participate in strategic product decisions
  • Partner with the engineering team to see projects through from concept to completion, discuss scope and tradeoffs, perform functional and visual QA, and provide detailed feedback
  • Be an individual contributor and own your own projects but also coach and mentor other designers on the team and provide product and creative direction

Requirements

 
  • 6+ years of experience designing digital products (not just websites). Experience working with productivity apps a major plus!
  • A portfolio that shows your design process of shipped work and a solid foundation in interaction and visual design
  • Values autonomy and is comfortable owning projects from start to finish
  • Hands-on attitude; willingness and ability to see your work through to production
  • Someone who can gracefully accept feedback and discuss the pros, cons, and options of their work
  • An active willingness to own mistakes and learn from them
  • A good listener who approaches design collaboratively, communicates proactively, and can explain the rationale of complex design decisions to many different stakeholders
  • Experience working with or building design systems
  • Experience using Figma and bonus if you’ve set up a design system there
  • Comfortable working with a fully remote team

Skills and experience are important but if this position sounds like a good fit for you, please apply!

Benefits

  • Fully subsidized healthcare (Medical, Dental & Vision)
  • $5k stipend to build your perfect workspace
  • $5k annual professional development stipend for technical training, career coaching, or anything else that will help you learn and continue to level up
  • 401k retirement plan
  • Life insurance (Basic, Voluntary & AD&D)
  • Unlimited paid time off (Vacation, Sick & Public Holidays)
  • Family leave (Parental)
  • Disability insurance (Short Term & Long Term)
  • Flexible, remote-first work policy
  • Equity ownership in LaunchNotes

 

Who we are

At LaunchNotes we believe that sharing information about product changes to the right people at the right time empowers teams and organizations to move faster together. Our company is centered around ensuring every stakeholder, internal and external, technical and non-technical, are always up to speed with the latest product changes even from the most prolific product teams. No one should ever be surprised about a new product feature, but this is all too common of a problem within the dynamic world of software companies.

We are a group of passionate individuals, excited about building a great product for our end users. We believe diverse perspectives encourage us to evolve and grow and become a better team and company by challenging the status quo every day. We believe transparency is paramount. We view LaunchNotes as a massive greenfield opportunity that can change the way product teams work together and greatly improve collaboration with their non-technical colleagues. We are backed by an incredible group of world-class investors and advisors.

LaunchNotes is a remote first company. Unfortunately we are only able to accept applications from individuals who reside within the United States.

results.title: Graphic Designer
results.description:
As a Graphic Designer at OptinMonster, you'll be responsible for equipping our users to grow their lists, leads and sales with high converting templates for popups, floating bars, fullscreens, slide-ins, inline and more. You'll also equip our team with landing pages, ad graphics, print publications, slide decks, featured image templates, social media and YouTube templates, tshirt designs, and more.

The OptinMonster family of products currently includes OptinMonster and TrustPulse, lead generation softwares used on over 1.2 million websites worldwide.

 

💡 Interested in applying?

🔍 Please read/follow the next steps outlined in "How to Apply" at the bottom of this listing.

Attention to detail is one of our core values! This is your chance to stand out :)

To love this role, here’s the type of person you are:
  • You are creative at heart. You have an eye for detail and are thoroughly skilled at developing assets at every level of marketing.
  • You bring feelings and ideas to life through design.
  • You’re a self-starter who takes initiative and sees things through from conception to completion.
  • You’re an excellent communicator, fluent in both verbal and written English. We believe communication is critical, and there is no such thing as over-communicating.
  • You take pride in the quality and craftsmanship of your work rather than just doing it to get it done - with great attention to detail.
  • You are comfortable giving critical feedback to peers (respectfully and productively) and don’t take feedback personally.
  • You’re happy working on tasks of all sizes.
  • You're a student of online marketing and e-commerce.

Common responsibilities include (but are not limited to):
  • Lead Generation Template Design and Production
    • Using suggestions from both your OptinMonster teammates and our customers, as well as your own understanding of our audience's needs, design and produce templates for popups, fullscreens, slide-ins, inline, floating bar and gamified campaigns.
  • Marketing Site UI/UX Design
    • Create illustrations, icons, thumbnails, banners, etc... for our websites.
  • Landing Page Design
    • Design landing pages for webinars, PPC advertising, partnerships, ebooks, etc...
  • Featured Image Templates
    • Create or maintain the Featured Image template files our content writers use to create featured images for our websites.
  • Social Media and Youtube Thumbnail Graphics
    • Collaborate with our social media manager to create and maintain a selection of social media templates they can utilize to quickly and easily produce on-brand content for social media.
    • Collaborate with our Video Producer to create and maintain a variety of Youtube thumbnails. Suggest tests for thumbnails based on current design trends.
  • Ad Banners
    • Create and maintain a wide variety of ad banners our affiliates can use to promote OptinMonster, for use in PPC campaigns, and that we can use on our own site, as needed.
  • Print Publications and Slide Decks
    • Create and maintain ebooks, white papers, checklists, guides, slide decks, etc... Most often, content will be provided, but you may be asked to use your own understanding of our product and existing collateral to produce specific pieces, too.
  • Email marketing templates and graphics
    • Create graphics and gifs used in email marketing templates.
  • Tshirt, Swag, and Event Design
    • Infrequently, design swag that will be used as giveaways to our customers, or used as internal company rewards.
    • Design conference booth backdrops, stands covers, postcards for use at industry conferences.
  • Product UI/UX
    • Product Design is not a primary responsibility of this role, but could evolve to include it for the right candidate under the direction of our Design Team Lead.

Requirements

  • 2-5 years experience as a graphic designer
  • At least 1 year working remotely
  • You’re a pro with design software like Figma and Adobe Photoshop
  • Additional software you'll use on a regular basis: Asana, Slack, Github, Gsuite, screencasting software

Bonus points if you also have:

  • Experience designing lead generation campaigns using OptinMonster or other similar software

 

HOW TO APPLY?
If all of this sounds interesting, then please submit your application and porfolio!

Also note, don't forget to proofread before submitting. Check spelling, capitalization, etc. This is your chance to make your application stand out :)

Benefits

Working for a fast-growing bootstrapped company is a rare opportunity, one we consider a lifestyle choice rather than a job choice. Our positions are challenging, but also come with amazing advantages and fulfillment to those who earn them. Here’s what we offer.

  • Competitive Salary.
  • Health, Dental, and Vision Insurance benefits for full-time U.S. employees.
  • Health Insurance benefits for all employees in India, Pakistan, Brazil, and Ukraine.
  • Work from your home. We’re spread out all over the world – United States, Canada, Ukraine, India, Pakistan, Singapore, and more.
  • Unlimited PTO after 90 days of employment. We encourage employees to take the time they need for a vacation, stay healthy, and spend time with friends and family.
  • Holidays (based on your location)
  • Paid maternity and paternity leave.
  • We happily provide or reimburse software you’ll need as well as books or courses that promote continued learning.
  • We cover all costs of company travel (including our annual all-company retreat and mini-team meetups).
  • Additional Perks such as AM Welcome Box for new team members, Yearly Anniversary Gifts, and Technology Stipend each work anniversary - including a new laptop to celebrate 5 year anniversary with the company.
  • We give you the opportunity to solve challenging and meaningful problems that make a difference.
  • Ability to work with some of the best people in the business through frequent, if not daily, interactions.
  • And in case you were wondering: no politics, no b.s., and no jerks.

Want to find out even more about Awesome Motive? Be sure to take a look at our About and Contributions pages for details on how Awesome Motive has continued to evolve in order to best help small businesses grow and compete with the big guys, and how we strive to give back.

Location
This is a remote position - our team is spread around the globe! Our home base is in Florida, USA, so company operating hours are 9am - 5pm ET (UTC -5). While this is a full time role and full coverage during that time is not a requirement, there are two Product team meetings each week which occur before 12:30AM ET you'll be required to attend.

Inclusion Statement
At Awesome Motive, we strive to have the broadest possible view of diversity, going beyond visible differences to include the background, experiences, skills, and perspectives that make each person unique. Awesome Motive is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace and is committed to equal employment opportunity regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, gender identity, veteran status, or any other basis protected by federal, state, or local law.

_____

We won’t be able to individually respond to all applications, but if we feel you’re a strong match, someone will be in touch shortly. A small test project will be required of all applicants selected for an interview.

Thanks and we look forward to hearing from you!

results.title: Mobile UI Designer
results.description:
Judo is searching for a talented Mobile UI Designer who is excited by the idea of joining a company that builds a powerful tool for other designers.

About Judo:

Judo empowers designers to design and build apps without code.

With Judo's Mac app, designers can build app UIs using the same frameworks as a developer, but through the use of a visual canvas instead of writing code. Judo helps designers fully imagine and envision what's possible, by putting them in the driver's seat and giving them complete control from concept to completion.

The output from Judo is more than a static image and more than a prototype—it is a fully functional app UI that is ready to be shipped to users instantly, without having to submit to the App/Play store.

Judo's iOS and Android SDKs are installed in close to 100 different apps reaching millions of users. Some of our customers include DraftKings, Cabela's, Chicago Bulls and New England Patriots.

We're backed by the same group that funded Shippabo, Airtable, LaunchKit and more (TenOneTen and Freestyle VC), a top U.S. accelerator as well as several prominent angel investors. We've built a solid reputation with several major sports franchises as clients, and are now charting new territory as we explore the multitude of other industries who could benefit from incorporating Judo into their native app workflows.

Our name derives from the martial art, a key principle of which is “maximum efficiency with minimal effort”. This concept is captured in our mission to enable product teams to build faster and iterate more frequently.

About our team:

We're a group of humans who believe that we're our most creative and most innovative when we have the flexibility to determine where and when we work. We're 100% remote and hire talented folks from all over the world. Currently we have team members based in Canada, Brazil, Scotland, South Korea, Spain and Poland. We're intentional about remote culture, and believe that meaningful connections and effective collaboration with teammates aren't only possible in a remote environment - but that they're crucial for organizational success.

Things move quickly around here. Judo is a fast-paced, self-directed, energetic environment where everyone is bringing a fiery passion to work every single day. We value hustle, balance, innovation, customer obsession, design-centricity and continuous learning. We're entrepreneurial in spirit, creative in our thinking, and experimental in our approach.

About the role:

As a Mobile UI Designer at Judo, you will contribute directly to Judo's iOS and Android apps, helping to enhance the look, feel and usability of apps that are used by other designers, mobile product teams and engineers. 

What will you do as a Mobile UI designer at Judo?

  • As a member of the product team, you'll be the lead designer for Judo's iOS and Android apps
  • Collaborate to build a holistic user experience and bridge overlapping functionalities between Judo's features and platforms 
  • Iterate on design solutions and ideas based on feedback from colleagues, customers and data insights
  • Work closely with the  Engineering Team to implement your designs

What we'd love to see in your work history:

  • 3+ years in a design or UX role on a product team
  • A love for the Mac, Apple software and extensive experience designing for one or more of Apple's platforms. Bonus points if this includes macOS!
  • Experience designing for native mobile apps
  • Strong understanding of native technologies (iOS + Android)
  • Some programming experience is ideal. This could be HTML/CSS, JavaScript or Swift! We're looking for a tech-savvy designer who can demonstrate their interest and ability to get their hands dirty when it comes to code.
  • An interest and/or experience with SwiftUI. Judo's visual design tool is based on SwiftUI so you'll need to understand it to be able to design for it.   
  • An extensive understanding of Figma including auto-layout and variants. Bonus points if you've ever worked on tooling that uses Figma's API!
  • Ability to balance great design solutions with an iterative approach
  • Strong understanding of human-centered design, visual design, UX strategy, prototyping, interaction design, user research, and user adoption

Some of the attributes we hope you'll bring to the role:

  • An exceptional design aesthetic
  • Passion for software
  • The ability to transform insights into delightful product experiences
  • Excitement about hands-on work, and a willingness to roll up your sleeves to get the job done
  • The ability to thrive in a fast-paced working environment with ever-changing challenges
  • Attention to detail - we'd love to see you mention “Kano Jigoro” in your cover letter
  • Entrepreneurial spirit 
  • The ability to be self-directed in your work
  • A fierce curiosity for your craft, always striving to learn more and improve yourself
  • The ability to wear many hats, find ways to bring value and a willingness to do what needs to be done
  • A desire to help our team continuously improve. We want you to teach us new things!
  • A demonstrated ability to be productive working remotely and an enthusiasm for remote work environments

A few of the reasons why you should join Judo:

  • We're a dynamic and entrepreneurial team working on the cutting edge of server-driven UI
  • Small, dynamic teams = massive impact
  • Be part of a high performing team of critical thinkers that thrive on problem-solving
  • Maintain optimal work-life balance in a remote environment with flexible hours
  • We're a quickly-growing startup with competitive salaries and stock option plan
  • Extended health and dental coverage for Canadian employees
  • Topped-up maternity and parental leave
  • Subsidized coworking memberships
  • We encourage open communication with management and company leadership
  • Participate in optional virtual social events regularly to connect with colleagues
  • Join us for in-person retreats with the full team twice annually
  • Take part in the Judo Meetup program, which encourages team members around the world to spend time together in person (expenses paid)
  • Work alongside an international team of smart, kind individuals who celebrate each other and care for each other

Start Date:

ASAP, but can be flexible according to the availability of the successful candidate.

If you don't have all of the attributes or particular experience we've listed above, please know that we would still love to hear from you! We understand that talent comes from many places and that skills are transferable.

Judo's total addressable market is vast, our platform is unique, and our team is ambitious. If you're eager to be a part of something big in this next chapter of your career - we'd love to have you aboard for liftoff. Apply now!

At Judo, we are committed to fostering an inclusive environment where everyone feels empowered to bring their authentic selves to work. Judo is an equal-opportunity employer, and we support applicants requesting accommodation at any stage of the interview process.

results.title: Senior Technical Artist (m/f/d)
results.description:
About DECA Games

We believe that games should be played for decades but many are abandoned even when a loyal community is screaming to keep them alive. DECA specializes in acquiring games from other developers and reinvigorating them to continue to entertain for decades. When other studios see an old game, we see an amazing set of problems to solve and a huge opportunity.  

DECA is a remote company with over 260 people in over 29 countries globally. DECA has been profitable since our inception in 2016. DECA is also a part of the Embracer Group, the largest public gaming company in Europe.

 

About our culture

We've managed to maintain a small company feel with the stability and resources of a much larger one. We fully believe in the flexibility of a remote workplace. Team members are trusted to manage their time and get things done independently. We believe that egos and politics need to be checked at the virtual door. That means no jerks are allowed, that no job is too small for anyone, and an openness to help and learn from each other is required. We love the challenge of working within constraints and love when we succeed as a team. Check out more about us and our values on our website (www.decagames.com).

This is a remote position. You can work from anywhere in the world in the CET timezone (9 am - 6 pm CET).
 

About the role

We are looking for a highly experienced Senior Technical Artist to work with our game teams across all DECA studios to research, create, implement and maintain production art pipeline solutions and tools.  You will have the responsibility to teach and guide our Technical Artists as well. 

 

Responsibilities
  • Work with the teams to build and maintain their art production pipelines and tools
  • Expert knowledge of the entire 3D and 2D pipelines
  • Experience with Unity and working with internal engines
  • Expert knowledge of implementing art assets
  • Experience with 3D software like Autodesk Maya and Mel / Python Scripting
  • Experience scripting in python, rust, ruby, photoshop javascript etc. for tool creation and art pipeline automation
  • Experience coding C# for tool creation
  • Experience in 3D art assets optimization for mobile games
  • Very Good understanding of game profiling and optimization, Memory optimization, Render Calls, fill rate etc.
  • Experience with gl and glsl shaders
  • Experience with creating shaders for both forward Rendering and URP pipelines
  • Be the champion of all Tech Art-related topics across DECA

 

Requirements
  • 5+ years of experience being a Technical Artist within the mobile gaming industry
  • Working knowledge of a wide range of art areas including 2D, 3D, modeling, animation, UI
  • Knowledge of 3D art creation Modeling / Texturing and engine implementation
  • Knowledge of 3D Character creation Pipeline, Highpoly, Retopo, baking etc.
  • Knowledge of Rigging and Skinning
  • VFX creation and implementation knowledge
  • Working before with procedural software like the Substance Package
  • Rendering: Cycles, Arnold etc.

 

Benefits
  • Remote first company culture.
  • Flexible work hours to support a personal work-life balance.
  • Weekly remote Embodiment@Work breathing and workout exercises.
  • Online language classes: English, German, French, Spanish etc.
  • Working in a multicultural environment with people from over 25 different countries.
  • Flat hierarchies with an open-door policy.

results.title: Graphic Designer
results.description:
Conquest Strategic Marketing is a street-smart, full-service ad agency focused on reaching today’s savviest consumers. We are developers of indelible creative and geo-targeted media campaigns that drive both foot and web traffic to companies of all sizes. Great creative concepts and less media waste deliver a higher ROI for our clients.

We are looking for a Graphic Designer to create engaging and on-brand graphics for a variety of media. What is the role of a Graphic Designer? The Graphic Designer job includes the entire process of defining requirements, visualizing and creating graphics including illustrations, logos, layouts and photos. You’ll be the one to shape the visual aspects of websites, books, magazines, product packaging, exhibitions and more. Your graphics should capture the attention of those who see them and communicate the right message. For this, you need to have a creative flair and a strong ability to translate requirements into design. If you can communicate well and work methodically as part of a team, we’d like to meet you. The goal is to inspire and attract the target audience.

 

Responsibilities
  • Study design briefs and determine requirements
  • Conceptualize visuals based on requirements
  • Prepare rough drafts and present ideas
  • Use the appropriate colors and layouts for each graphic
  • Develop illustrations, logos and other designs using software or by hand
  • Test graphics across various media
  • Work with copywriters and creative director to produce final design
  • Ensure final graphics and layouts are visually appealing and on-brand

Requirements

    • A keen eye for aesthetics and details
    • Proven graphic designing experience
    • A strong portfolio of illustrations or other graphics
    • Familiarity with design software and technologies (such as InDesign, Illustrator, Dreamweaver, Photoshop)
    • Ability to work methodically and meet deadlines

      Tools required for remote work

results.title: Senior Product Designer
results.description:
Ganymede is building AWS for the sciences, with a mission of improving the world through better healthcare outcomes. We believe that the highest leverage approach to speed up science is through better software and data connectivity.

As a Senior Product Designer, you’ll own our end-to-end user experience design and research at the tactical and strategic level.

  • You will develop user journeys in close concert with scientists (at times in-person in their labs), ideate and prototype interfaces for improving engagement with lab instrumentation and data in our core product, and collaborate closely with software engineers to bring your designs to life.
  • You’ll help us define our overall UX strategy, user personas, and help drive our investment in building out a UX organization as we grow
  • You’ll also help us with our marketing content, design, and research in the early days, building an understanding of users at the sales and marketing stage, not just at the implementation and product usage stage
  • You'll also be a key determinant of our culture, and will help us grow and set norms for the business as we scale


Our principles

  • Improving lives through better medicine: we’re intensely mission-focused, and are building a highly scalable business to make an impact on society.
  • Kindness: we come from a future where all human beings are treated with dignity, inclusivity, and active empathy, so we apply that to ourselves first in how we hire and treat each other.
  • Transparency: we are one team, and hold that openness is foundational to ensuring fairness, and that our actions tie to our shared mission.
  • Accountability: we believe that trust is the basis for building anything substantial, and stems from our being accountable to ourselves and each other.

Requirements

What we look for:

  • 3+ years of product design and UX research experience in a product whose users can code (e.g. software engineers or data scientists)
  • Demonstrated ability to manage UX development end-to-end, from initial research, concept exploration, persona development, interaction flow diagrams, wireframes, prototypes, testing, and post-launch feedback
  • Fluency with mockup tools such as Figma or Sketch, with portfolio of work demonstrating UX/UI capabilities
  • Great collaboration and communication skills

Pluses (but not required by any means!):

  • Background doing front-end web development in HTML/CSS with React or associated frameworks
  • Experience working in a lab environment, or working with scientists/analysts as users
  • Familiarity with Developer Experience (DevEx) best practices and Release Engineering (RelEng)/Developer Operations (DevOps) generally

Benefits

  • Remote-first role and culture, with periodic reimbursed travel for the team to meet together
  • Significant equity as an early employee
  • Unlimited PTO & sick days
  • Excellent health benefits (Medical, Dental & Vision), life, and disability insurance
  • Family leave (Maternity, Paternity, Medical, Caregiver)


Salary Range
  • 130K-180K

results.title: VP, Product Design
results.description:
Real Vision helps people understand the complex world of finance, business, and the global economy with real in-depth analysis by real experts through the power of its community.

The company is on a mission to democratize the very best financial intelligence for all and become the one place where everyone lives their financial lives.

This enhanced platform will offer members different learning journeys that put them in control of their finances. Members will be able to watch videos, listen to podcasts, monitor market prices, analyze markets and economies, do technical analysis, create watch lists, read and publish research, monitor their portfolios, execute trades across both Tradfi and Crypto, and contribute to a thriving hive mind community.

We are looking for a VP of Product Design to help us build a world-class product design org that makes our platforms and apps feel like magic. 

Reporting to the Chief Experience Officer, you’ll partner with cross-functional leaders and guide product design teams to shape what our members want, need, and are ready for at specific points in their financial journeys. You’ll also work closely with the Head of Creative and our creative studio that is responsible for brand identity to ensure everything we design conveys a consistent brand experience.

Your track record of putting communities and people at the center of everything has contributed to thriving human-centered cultures that make amazing consumer-facing products. Inspiring others to think big – really big -- to imagine what’s possible while zooming into the details gets you up every morning.

What You Will Do 

Experience in these critical areas will set you up for success in this role. 


Product Thinking:
  • Partner with product and insights leadership to develop a solid understanding of our community through a mix of qual & quant research 
  • Partner with product and insights leadership to build better processes for developing even deeper customer understanding (e.g., dashboards, research reports, etc.) 
  • Help turn strategy into product -- participating in and often facilitating jam sessions to go from insights to ideas 
  • Play a hands-on role when needed to create mock-ups and prototypes that help visualize how we go from ideas to action 


Cross-Functional Leadership:
  • Form effective partnerships with product, data & insights, engineering, marketing, revenue, and content leadership -- holding each other accountable and driving alignment 
  • Collaborate with these leaders to develop healthy, inclusive cross-functional teams that trust one another 
  • Help these teams understand how their work ladders-up to company-level strategic goals 
  • Provide clear updates to the business on behalf of teams as needed


People Management:
  • Lead a matrixed design org of 10+ people across IA, UX, and UI 
  • Recruit and onboard talent as we grow 
  • Improve our processes for attracting high-quality, diverse candidates 
  • Provide continuous candid feedback to designers on their performance 
  • Identify and nurture future design leaders within Real Vision 


Design Execution:
  • Evolve our processes & principles to work better for our current stage of design maturity
  • Partner with product leadership to drive executional alignment on our roadmap
  • Provide Feedback on prioritization, roadmapping, and scoping
  • Help lead decisions around quality/effort tradeoffs
  • Ensure design capacity is factored into roadmap decisions
  • Build a network of freelances, agencies, etc. and processes to scale design quickly when needed
  • Support and/or lead concept design for new features - contributing directly when necessary
  • Develop a consistent, on-brand design system in partnership with Head of Creative
  • Guide executional design work
  • Provide clear, effective feedback through written feedback, design crits, and 1:1 working sessions
  • Help reinforce a culture where we ship quickly and often to help make better decisions


Who you are:
  • Managed design teams/orgs for 10+ years
  • Designed personalized digital experiences for different personas and their respective user journeys
  • Shipped digital products with a mix of features developed (a.) in house (b.) by 3rd-parties (i.e., lots of integration experience)
  • Worked across a diverse ecosystem of websites (desktop, mobile), native mobile apps (iOS, Android), OTT apps (AppleTV, Android TV, etc.), in-vehicle apps (CarPlay, Android Auto), and complex desktop aps (MacOs, Windows, Linux)
  • You have been inside companies or agencies where speed, agility, and constantly shipping features mattered
  • You have startup and/or early growth stage experience
  • Worked with diverse cross-functional groups that go beyond typical agile software teams
  • Familiar with agile product development process...and understand when to deviate from what's prescribed based on what makes sense for the business
  • Wired to find solutions, take action, and get concepts out in the wild
  • Embrace and educate others on product design best practices
  • Have a growth mindset
  • Lead with positive energy
  • Juggle multiple things at once in stride
  • Communicate ideas concisely and clearly
  • Passionate about finance and crypto and enjoy going down these rabbit holes
  • Ideally, you are (or have been) a Real Vision subscriber or member
  • You can point to work that shows how you've made complex digital products dead simple to use


What we offer:
  • Real Vision is 100% remote
  • Competitive Salary
  • Equity Grants
  • 100% covered health, vision, dental for the individual employee (with family coverage at a heavily reduced rate)
  • 401k with 4% match
  • 20 days PTO, US holidays and 5 sick days
  • Real Vision All Access Membership
